      • toInt

        public static int toInt(byte[] data)
        Converts a byte array with 4 elements to an int. Used to put ints into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow).
        Taken from http://www.daniweb.com/code/snippet216874.html
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        Returns:
        the resulting int
        See Also:
        toBytes(int)

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes(int data)
        Converts an int to a byte array with 4 elements. Used to put ints into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow).
        Taken from http://www.daniweb.com/code/snippet216874.html
        Parameters:
        data - the int to convert
        Returns:
        the resulting byte[] array
        See Also:
        toInt(byte[])

        Convenience method to transform an int[] array to a byte array for serialization.
        Parameters:
        data - the int[] to convert
        Returns:
        the resulting byte[] 4 times in size (4 bytes per int)

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes(float data)
        Converts a float to a byte array with 4 elements. Used to put floats into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow). Use toFloat(byte[]) to decode.
        Parameters:
        data - the float to convert
        Returns:
        the resulting byte array
        See Also:
        toFloat(byte[])

      • toFloat

        public static float toFloat(byte[] data)
        Converts a byte array with 4 elements to a float. Used to put floats into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow). Use toBytes(float) to encode.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        Returns:
        the resulting float
        See Also:

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes(double data)
        Converts a double to a byte array with 4 elements. Used to put doubles into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow). Use toDouble(byte[]) to decode. Note that there is a loss in precision as the double is converted to a float in the course of conversion.
        Parameters:
        data - the double to convert
        Returns:
        the resulting byte array
        See Also:
        toDouble(byte[])

      • toDouble

        public static double toDouble(byte[] data)
        Converts a byte array with 4 elements to a double. Used to put doubles into a byte[] payload in a convenient and fast way by shifting without using streams (which is kind of slow). Use toBytes(double) to encode. Note that there is a loss in precision as the double is converted to a float in the course of conversion.
        Parameters:
        data - the input byte array
        Returns:
        the resulting float
        See Also:
        toBytes(double)
